A true masterpiece and is still worth playing in 2019.

Portal é uma game em primeira pessoa, focado na resolução de puzzles, onde usando uma arma capaz de abrir portais você deve ir progredindo por cenários e superando uma série de desafios. 

O enredo de Portal funciona mais como uma explicação, você é uma jovem chamada Chell, que é selecionada para realizar uma série de testes, bem ao estilo rato de laboratório. Ao longo do game você é guiado por GLaDOS, um computador inteligente meio psicótico que também acaba responsável por parte da narrativa do game. 

O grande ponto forte do game fica na mecânica de utilização dos portais e no carisma dos personagens. A campanha ainda assim não é longa, sendo possível ser terminada em pouco mais de duas horas, mas mesmo assim esse clássico da Valve vale muito a pena.

In a word, wonderful. It is incredible when a game that has a core so simple as get from point A to point B adds such a spice to it that it makes you want to play over and over again. With what starts as a nice little testing center for a portal gun and takes such a fun and exciting turn it had my grinning from ear-to-ear the entire time. After receiving all of the achievements for this game and beating the many story three times in just a couple of days I can tell you that I enjoyed every second of it. There were times that I would get frustrated with the challenge chambers but the feeling of success after completing each one made it totally worth it. Easily the best credit role in video game history. 10/10 would recommend.
Absolutely freakin' hilarious! Mighty fine puzzle gameplay too! Buy it! But it now!!!

A great classic game for your steam library. This is the case you to its unique characters. The characters are funny and sometimes downright horrifying. This is one of the only games that has had me think about the characters and plat long after i beat it. 10/10

In one sentence, Portal is.

A 3-5 hour physics puzzle game sprinkled with some "techno horror" elements and surroundings(those audio techniques are really impressive) that feels more like a playthrough of chapter 1 of a completed game.

Recommended, but to a niche audience of people who like techno horror?

Its a nice game. I got Portal and Portal 2 on sale for $3, so I had to buy it. I've always wanted to play this game because it was so popular, but I was kind of disappointed in the play time. I beat the game in 3 hours from beginning to end. Most of the game is the same mechanics but in different forms. Like jumping from a high platform to reach another, knocking over turrets, etc. I give it a 3/5. 

Buy when it's on sale.
